pullRequest.body:
The new definitions of `Nat.bitCasesOn` and `Nat.binaryRec*` have better runtime performance. Also they have lighter weight dependencies now and may be upstreamed to `Batteries` later.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [91bfda20c9](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15571/commits/91bfda20c96ab80d247b7ada304083f8f410e4d1)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ bit_decide_mod_two_eq_one_shiftRight_one`
`+ bit_div_two`
`+ bit_shiftRight_one`
`+ bit_testBit_zero_shiftRight_one`
`+ shiftRight_one`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

:v: FR-vdash-bot can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11404808649/job/31734789468)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11404808649/job/31734789195)

This generally looks good to me.

Can you add a sentence or two in the PR description explaining the motivation (which is some combination of performance, and wanting to drop bodd / div2, right?)
What are you trying to convey here? Is the point that when you unfold `bitCasesOn` in the dependent case, this is easier to eliminate?
I updated the doc string to explain it more clearly.
While you're here, and before you move things; could you rename `C` to `motive` in these recursors too?

```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem bit_testBit_zero_shiftRight_one (n : Nat) : bit (n.testBit 0) (n >>> 1) = n := by
```
Ah, I now see that `testBit` is not simp-normal; perhaps better to just ignore this suggestion.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: redefine `Nat.bitCasesOn` `Nat.binaryRec`
